content:
Absolutely! Rouen has a lot to offer, beyond just its delicious local cuisine. Here are some activities to consider:

1. Visit Rouen Cathedral: This stunning Gothic cathedral was made famous by Monet's series of paintings and is a must-see attraction in the city. 2. Explore the historic Old Town: Rouen's Old Town is full of picturesque narrow streets, half-timbered houses, and charming squares. Don't miss the Gros Horloge, a beautiful astronomical clock that dates back to the 14th century. 3. Check out the Musée des Beaux-Arts: This art museum has an impressive collection of paintings and sculptures, including works by Monet, Renoir, and other famous artists. 4. Take a stroll along the Seine riverfront: Rouen is situated on the banks of the Seine, and a walk along the riverfront is a great way to enjoy the city's beautiful architecture and views. 5. Visit the Jardin des Plantes: This lovely botanical garden is a peaceful retreat from the hustle and bustle of the city. It features a wide variety of plants, including a large collection of orchids. These are just a few of the many activities you can enjoy in Rouen. Whether you're interested in history, art, or simply soaking up the local culture, there's something for everyone here.
